channel.description: can anyone help me out with DSL embedded it wont start :( EDIT: I did exactly what it said on the site and got a cmd and then it vanished without a trace. If anyone can help me thatw'd be great.

item.title: [NEVER MIND] DTSM (Damn that small linux)
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:3, topic:136856”]I’ve heard of it, and am installing it now on my USB flash stick. Let’s see how it goes. If it works, I’ll tell you what I did. :D[br][size=1]Posted on: August 28, 2007, 12:34:45 AM[/size][hr]Wow, this Linux distro is very very fast. I’m running it live from my pen drive and I don’t plan to install it. Just fun to play with it. My only gripe is that it has a real old version of Firefox installed (1.0.6). The task manager seems to be built into the desktop on the top right. It says it’s only using 58.9M of memory. That’s pretty sick. Ubuntu and Microsoft XP (with tons of hacking) uses 4 times that. I wish I knew how to take a screenshot. I tried pressing Prt Scrn, and pasting it in xPaint, but no luck.

Anyway, I used this cool tutorial and it worked perfectly!
http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2007/01/02/all-in-one-usb-dsl/

This linux distro is perfect for old computers or just slow computers in general. My other computer has Ubuntu installed but it’s very slow. It used to have Windows 98 on it lol. I think I might just install this on it. Thanks for asking the question. Without you, I would be too lazy to do anything.

~Ron[/quote]
ty ill chack the tut

i cant get it to run in windows under qemu.

Read full topic

item.title: [NEVER MIND] DTSM (Damn that small linux)

item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I’ve heard of it, and am installing it now on my USB flash stick. Let’s see how it goes. If it works, I’ll tell you what I did. :D[br][size=1]Posted on: August 28, 2007, 12:34:45 AM[/size][hr]Wow, this Linux distro is very very fast. I’m running it live from my pen drive and I don’t plan to install it. Just fun to play with it. My only gripe is that it has a real old version of Firefox installed (1.0.6). The task manager seems to be built into the desktop on the top right. It says it’s only using 58.9M of memory. That’s pretty sick. Ubuntu and Microsoft XP (with tons of hacking) uses 4 times that. I wish I knew how to take a screenshot. I tried pressing Prt Scrn, and pasting it in xPaint, but no luck.

Anyway, I used this cool tutorial and it worked perfectly!
http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2007/01/02/all-in-one-usb-dsl/

This linux distro is perfect for old computers or just slow computers in general. My other computer has Ubuntu installed but it’s very slow. It used to have Windows 98 on it lol. I think I might just install this on it. Thanks for asking the question. Without you, I would be too lazy to do anything.

~Ron
